content: yes — GPs do the best they can to judge when new investments from one fund will end a second will start — but it is still more art than science. the capital markets were very rocky in the beginning of 2016 so some folks did anticipate a downturn and raised anticipating the ability to invest into that. While a market downturn did not happen second half of the year, venture funding into companies did slow so GPs investing pace generally speaking slowed which also pushed out the use of new funds.
